description: Had to give the 5 for having like the worlds worst- I don't a fuck bartender. Yep its a dive. Don't bitch and complain cos you know what its gonna be like. I work pretty close to this spot so hit it once in a while. One time the TV blew out on the wall at like 6ish; bartender dude who looks like Ray Davies of the Kinks jumps up on bar; walks over the TV outlet clacking his beatles boots along the way not giving a single fuck to all the people drinking at the bar. He turns around and looks at me and says..." the fucking owners don't pay me enough to die like this"....
author: Cuthbert S.

description: Worst service of the night. Bartenders try to scam you and there is no loyalty to customers. There's plenty of places in San Francisco don't waste your time here.
author: Lorena M.

description:
Eh. This dive bar wasn't awesome. And as dive bar goes, paying $5.50 for a bottle of Lagunitas is pricy. Am I crazy for thinking that? 

Bartenders aren't the friendliest, fellow patrons range from some local loons to reflecting the neighborhood with some upscale patrons. A friend brought me here to watch the Warriors and I asked for not crowded and it wasn't crowded, so there's that.

A few pool tables in the back and cash only makes this a better spot for the regulars, or if you randomly meander in versus a destination one stop shop.
author: Stephanie Y.

description:
This is a good place to stop and be a real person.

I like the place.  I like the customers.  You feel very at home here, and even thought it is a bit rough around the edges, it's a good place for people with good taste in divey places.  They have cheap Bud.  They have pool.  It's a good crowd.

The biggest draw are the pool tables.  They have a nice back area with two tables and good space.  It's a really chill spot to come with a bigger group and be able to still have individual conversations.

It's been here for years.  People keep coming back.
author: Adam S.

description: I like this place because they have 2 pool tables with cheap draft beer. Friendly bartender. No complaints at all.
author: Jeff S.

description: Although the bar itself was pretty standard, one of the bartenders here was the rudest, most aggressive woman I have ever met in my life. I went to the restroom with my friend, and while in there, someone pounded on the door repeatedly, yelling because she had to pee (even though we were only in there for a couple minutes). She even walked in TWICE within the span of two minutes because the lock was broken, the second time knowing that we hadn't left yet. When we did exit the bathroom after a total of five minutes at the very maximum, she made an extremely rude comment to me, to which I replied "chill out."  I thought this was pretty fair and I remained level-headed, given that she had just compromised my privacy and purposefully walked in on me pissing not once, but twice. She then proceeded to scream at me to "get the fuck out of 'her' bar." I don't usually like to pass judgement, as she was clearly either extremely inebriated while on the job or having a bad day, but I don't think there's any excuse for that.
author: Skyler L.

description: My girlfriend and I stopped in last night.  Like other reviewers, We loved the jukebox.  We played a lot of 80's punk rock, and just good, classic tunes from The Replacements, The Clash, The Cure, The Supersuckers, Hank 3 , Stiff Little Fingers, etc....  Drink prices were good, selection was good.  Our bartender hustled.  People were friendly.  Will come back to this place.  Lots of space here too.
author: Chris G.

description: Tre the drummer made us feel so welcome and at home on this gloomy Sunday evening. Great place to knock back some shots and a PBR with great specials, pool tables, people, and community vibe! Definitely making this my regular spot!¡
author: Victoria T.

description: I like this place.  Decent dive bar to go to before any shows at Regency or Social Hall.  They have pool tables and a few areas to lounge.  Not much more to add really.
author: Anh N.

description: Love Tre! Best bar I've ever visited in the city!!! Tre (spelling?) favorite bartender!!! Wish he was in sac town!
author: Gabriella N.

description:
Route 101 is no dive by any stretch of the imagination. They have clean stools - and plenty of them, by their well-stocked bar - a charming, self-referencing mural, and at least one pool table, plus at least one TV. This bar is a narrow space: larger than their outside suggests, there's room to relax on a couch, play pinball, or enjoy one of the many beers they have on tap.

If you stop in right after lunch - especially on a weekday - don't be surprised if you're the only one there. (Be sure to visit when they have drink specials.)

My accomplice and I each took down Irish car bombs ($7.50; cash only, with an ATM nearby) and kamikaze shots prepared by John, the friendly barkeep. Nothing like midday drinks, eh?
author: Dave L.

description: Trey is the baddest bitch this side of Oakland! If he were weed he'd be the dopest dope I ever smoked! Stylish as fuuuuck! Awesome stories and great drinks, come see brotha man!
author: Elena A.

description: I went here with a few friends around 5pm on Halloween. I have no problem with the bar, its divey and has character. However, the bartender was so incapacitated he could barely function or stand, let alone tend bar. The place was near empty and he was ignoring us. He forgot our drink orders and disappeared for quite a while. Needless to say we left.
author: Rodger B.

description:
NOTE: Cash only. Whatever, man. Who cares.

Route 101 is a great place to get a drink. I mean that in the most literal sense. You want to go to a place, have a drink, sit with a bunch of people who too want a drink, maybe to talk to themselves, that's this place. It's dark, but not too dark. It smells okay. The beer selection is good. The bar staff are awesome. They'll talk if you want to talk or stay quiet if you want to be quiet. I love coming here because there is not an iota of pretension or judgment. Have a good damn time.
author: Ed Z.

description:
I seem to come here about once a decade.  So I've been here twice.  I noticed a few changes.

- there was an eJukebox advertising Tailor Swift
- Poweraide was behind the bar not Gatoraid

Um....I think thats about it.
author: David S.

description: Place smells cigarettes and was kinda dirty. My friends and I left when the roaches started crawling on us.
author: Mark G.

description:
Came here since it's down the street and I like checking out my local spots.

Im almost 30 and the bartender checked my ID as if he was a Customs officer. Relax! Im don't look underage. Haha.

$7 for a draft beer??? Damn, very pricey for a dive bar. The place had 5 patrons. Nothing special or worth seeing. I recommend skipping this one.
author: Jonathan M.

description: Great dive bar that is everything a dive bar is. Sticky with questionable bathrooms and bar seats on their last legs? Definitely! Lovely bartenders who make good, non-fussy drinks at affordable prices - $12 for a well vodka soda and a delicious dirty martini. I'm a fan.  I've only come in on nights when it isn't crowded, and that is probably a helpful tip.
author: Alison K.

description:
Would I ever just make my way to this bar to hang out?  Never.  It has no real draw, and is not located all that conveniently.  Unless, that is, you are going to a concert at the Regency next door.  This is the go to spot for drinks before a show here, for a couple reasons.  It is easy to meet at so you and your friends can find each other without climbing through throngs of people in the venue,  drinks are inexpensive, so as you wait for your friends who always show up late, you won't break your bank sitting here, and finally, it is literally next door, so you can pay attention to the crowd gathered outside in the smoking area for an idea of whether an opener is on, or it is between bands.  

This is my go to spot for pre-concert relaxing.
author: Dick S.

description:
Pool for a dollar
2 Pool tables
Cheap Beer
And its right across the street from home...
author: Antoine V.

description:
The only good thing about this place are the pool tables. 
The prices are not cheap  and they don't have a dishwasher so your glasses are not exactly clean. 
The brunette bartender is nice but the red head who works Friday and Saturday nights is brutal: NEVER says thank you for tipping her and in general is just rude.
The bathrooms are foul.  Also don't put any food down or you will find a cockroach on it in 2 seconds.
author: Wes W.

description: $2 pbr and superrrrr cheap pool. It smells a little like castro valley bowl but it's a chill place to go shoot the shit and enjoy a cheap beerskee.
author: Jess C.

description: CASH ONLY. HANDY-DANDY ATM MACHINE AVAILABLE TO WITHDRAW MONIES. This dive bar was conveniently located a few blocks from the hotel I was staying at. The boyfriend and I had a couple drinks, decided to bar hop, and ended up at Route 101 for the remainder of the night/morning. $4 well drinks, friendly female bartender, plenty of seating, an assortment of munchies to snack on, and people to watch -- I was entertained.
author: Jennae H.

description: I was visiting from out of town (a small, "hick" town down the coast). I must say that I've never felt so at home in the city. This place was awesome! Pool tables, jukebox, cheap -strong- drinks, and friendly atmosphere. Best part of all: Alli, the bartender. By far the BEST bartender I've ever encountered. She's a "take no bullshit sweetheart" that has that place on lock. Although she wasn't working while I was there, I also got to know the other bartender,  Nicole, who was also awesome. Anytime I'm in the city, you'll find me here.
author: Ashley M.

description:
My BFF and I had each had a stressful week so we decided to decompress last night with cocktails and a cheesy movie.

Before heading down to 1000 Van Ness we parked our behinds on a couple of bar stools at Route 101.

Last time I was there was almost 6 years ago when I was pregnant. I hasten to add that I only had 7-UP...my baby daddy drank beer while I looked on with envy.

Anyhow, last night we only had about 30 minutes before the movie so we were in shot-slamming mode. The bartender raised an eyebrow at us but we paid him no mind as we plowed through 3 shots apiece. The bar is just as I remembered it...low-key, comfortable, completely lacking in pretense.

And the perfect place to catch a nice glow before the show.
author: Valeria R.

description: First place I went after finishing the Bay to Breakers. I've been by here a million times but never went in and was always curious. Turns out to be a lot bigger than I expected.. As I said, I went after B2B so it was like 1030-11am and there were only like 4-5 other people there. I got a kick out of the "Alcoholics Anonymous" book nestled beneath the TV in the bookcase,.I can't imagine it being especially "happening" even on Saturday night or whatever but maybe that's a good thing,.I liked it..bonus points for selling pitchers,.
author: Morris D.

description:
I've only been here once, so maybe this is a typical night at Route 101. You tell me...

A few years ago, the weekend after Michael Jackson died, we were partying all afternoon on my buddy's roof deck and were feeling no pain. Things were dieing down, and so we decided to head to Route 101 on a buddy's suggestion. I'm glad we did, because I could not make up what happened next.  

We walk in the bar and sure enough, "Billy Jean" comes on the jukebox. Out come the moonwalks, crotch grabs, and "Hooooo!" and "Hee heeee!" screams. I guess my antics were impressive because this guy, who can be best described as a pimp (for real), gave me his fedora and big black sunglasses to wear. I jumped on the couch and proceeded to show off my best MJ moves [insert crowd applause and "woo woo!"s here].

Anyway, later on I go to order drinks at an empty space on the other side of the bar from my friends. I see some commotion down their way, but I don't know what's going on. After I get the drinks, I come back to my friends and they tell me that the young blonde girl in the summer dress, who is with the "pimp", suddenly attacked my friend Jim and wrestled him to the ground.

I look over at her and I can see this crazy-ass look in her eyes. I set my drink on the bar, because I can sense what is coming next. She lowers a shoulder and attacks me! Now she only weighs about 100 lbs, but has a rabid wild animal type fight that explodes out of her. Pretty soon we're on the ground with a flurry of head-locks, strangle-holds, and pins. I even had her ready for the pile driver at one point with me standing and her legs over my head. Well, the bartender saw about enough and came over to break up the show. We stopped, shook hands, hugged, and toasted our drinks.

We had great fun that night and experienced a "Hangover" type moment the next day. During the wrestling, my girlfriend was taking photos with my camera. We looked through them and noticed a few details that we missed the night before, like the girl's bloody knees, her boobs popping out, and (ummm, how do I say this?) a string hanging out of her.

All and all it was a great evening. I think it may be time to go back for round two!!
author: Dave L.

description: Great divey bar!! Cool jukebox and sweet bartender named trey! Trey is a total hunk!!!!!!
author: Alicia P.

description: A comfy dive filled with couches and pool tables and people popping coins in the well curated jukebox.  Nothing special, but a good spot for a drink and conversation.
author: Dana S.

description: Drinks are strong, very reasonably priced... they have two pool table and one pinball. There is Ample street parking available. Bartender is cool
author: Astha S.

description: No bouncer, but the bartender asked to check id. The bartender was nice, drinks were pretty cheap, but cash only. Jager on tap. Sprite was kind of flat. Music was pretty random. Older crowd here.
author: Karen D.

description:
Maybe the bartender wasn't expecting two wide eyed Asian alcoholics to stumble into his empty bar at 3pm on a weekday, but that's indeed what he got.  And what we got is an attitude so ambivalent, indifferent and, in a way, sorta "angry", that all I really wanted to do was just stay awhile and drink, just to take the edge off.  

So that's what we did.  I usually don't drink shots (by choice), but the surly bartender John (note: actually a nice guy once you get to talking with him) made us the nastiest tasting Irish Car Bombs we ever had that I ended up having to chase the nastiness down with a Kamikaze.  To John's credit, he kept emphasizing the fact that he doesn't do the whole "college thing" (read: shots), and I kept on emphasizing the fact that hey, neither do I, but my friend was the one ordering and paying (p.s. thanks Dave H!)

Overall, if you do come here, for the love of God (and baby Jesus) don't do shots.  Instead, have a beer, play pool and ask the bartender how his day is going.  You'll be fine and boozed up in no time.

2.5 stars
author: Luke S.

description:
Route 101 is one part local dive and one part tourist.  It's close proximity to several hotels and high visibility seems to invite a good number of poor saps who can only visit this great city.

However there are plenty of drunk old  locals here too.  Last time I was there, one such old drunk was fruitlessly trying to find out the favorite flowers of the bartender.  Eventually she was like, "I don't really like flowers." To which he excitedly replied "Then I'll go pick you some grass!" Then downed the last of his drink and confidently strode out the door on a mission.

Reasonably strong drinks (6.5/10 on the booz-o-meter), and really cheap prices.  Act like a big shot and buy a round of well shots for the house - $3.50 for their well whiskey.

A couple pool tables in the back, cool bartenders both times I've been, and a good (if not schizophrenic) jukebox selection make this a good place to stop in for a drink or two.
author: Nathan M.

description: Great place to sit & drink while waiting to go to a show at the Regency.  Drinks were good (wish they were a little stronger) and the service was wonderful.
author: Lara F.

description:
San Francisco, there was I.
And this Saturday evening was boring!
Boring to the point that I felt that for entertainment, only a couple of Irish Car Bombs would do the trick. 
Yes, I meant the beverage of mixed alcohol, (the black liquid gold of Ireland known as Guinness, Baileys Irish Cream and the water of life, Jameson Irish Whiskey), YES, I meant a beverage and not the actual explosives that my maternal cousins set off in the Northern part of the Emerald Isle. 
Whenever I am here in the city by the bay, I crave strong alcohol and tonight, a game of pool. 
I somehow found my way from the outer Richmond to Route 101.
Once inside I ordered my drink (an Irish Car Bomb) with a PBR chaser. 
Now about that game of pool; Between the darkness on the street and the doorway filled with light enters the legendary Eddly and he wants to hustle me at a game of pool.
 But first he sends his girl, Carmen to get us a couple beers. 
Not just any beer but Pabst Blue Ribbon, of course!
During the hustle, we both sipped our sophisticated drink (the aforementioned "Irish Car Bomb") and slammed another round of PBR's whilst Eddly sank shot after shot, calling out the eight ball in the side pocket to complete the spectacle.
I soon learned that Eddly's resume as a pool hustler includes hustling on "the long and winding road" and later, the professional tournament circuit. 
However, on this very evening Eddly finally came head-to-head across the table with the legendary (and far more treacherous) pool shark (not just any pool shark), our old friend and alternative rock bass guitarist, eL Capitan himself!
Surprisingly, Eddly won their match, only to find out that eL Capitan lost deliberately, having had money riding against himself. 
Being a gracious man, eL Capitan gave Eddly the equivalent of  $10,000 Philippine peso as a cut from the bet but Eddly gave the pesos back to eL Capitan and told him that it was simply an honor to play pool with him. 
Not one to forgo an opportunity for a fiesta, eL Capitan order a round of drinks for the entire barroom clientele.
 "Usted es un digno adversario. Por favor, amigo mío, por favor, tomar una copa conmigo" eL Capitan said to Eddly but since I don't speak Spanish, I have no idea what he meant. 
Next thing I knew, the bartender, the cute dark-haired, Irish bartender, set us up with another round of Pabst Blue Ribbon.
Someone played the Irish Rovers (or U2, not sure which as I often get those two bands confused) on the jukebox and a group of really cute (Irish?) girls start dancing. 
Well, of course they both grabbed eL Capitan by the arms and began to do "Riverdance" and most everyone in the bar joined in.
It was an epic dancehall recital with Irish Car Bombs, Irish pop music and Irish dancing. 
At the peak of the evening, eL Capitan and the dark haired Irish bartender (the one that looks like a young Catherine Zeta-Jones) ran outside and rode off into the night on eL Capitan's vintage Norton bobber.
"See you on the other side" eL Capitan yelled as they motored off towards the Bay Bridge on ramp.
"Guess they're goin' to Alameda" Carmen said.
"Hella NO!" Eddly said with a serious tone, "OAKLAND!"

After watching them ride away, Eddly, Carmen, an Irish dancer named Stella and ME, went back inside and ordered another round of drinks and played another game of pool . . .

If you ever find yourself in the city by the bay and you are looking for a great "dive" bar with an awesome staff, reasonably priced drinks and awesome ambiance, get some cash and head over to ROUTE 101

PS - TIP YOUR BARTENDER(S)!!!!
author: Dave S.

description:
ROACH PROBLEM. STAY AWAY FROM DARK CORNERS

This place has a roach colony under the bar. If the lighting is sufficiently dark and you are in the corner you may make a new buddy with antennae. In my 60 minutes there I saw 4

Really? For god's sakes management, this may be a dive bar but I have never seen a roach in any other establishment in my 20 years in SF.

Just spend the $500 on an exterminator. Sheer disregard for your workers and guests. Disgusting.
author: C S.

description:
Now this is the kind of place you'd see on TV in a biker bar fight only without the bikers and without the fight.  Had enough time to run in for a quick drink before out meeting and noticed that they really don't offer anything else but booze.  The bartender was cool and said we could order a sandwich next door and eat it in there so we did.  

Other than that, Can't really say anything bad about the place.  I'm sure there are nights when this place is packed but we went in there for lunch so it was okay.
author: Michael D.

description:
Hey you have to review dive bars with the fact that it is a dive bar in mind.  So you can't give them low marks for being dirty, etc.  So that's why I'm giving the 101 four stars.  I've seen that sign forever and last night had to go check it out after a random Of Montreal show I saw at the Great American Music Hall earlier.  As the sign says, they have a big tv and pool table.  

The crowd was an interesting mix of folks but everyone seemed cool, even the guy with tattoos covering his face.  I found Southern Culture on the Skids on the jukebox which impressed me since I used to see them play in dumps and barns in Alabama in my college days.  At least go once!
author: Gene X.

description:
I came here with a friend before the Dandy Warhols show at The Regency. It's not bad, but not great either, somewhere in the middle. The red-haired bartendress steered me away from The Guinness, saying it was a little funky that night. Okay. It was fairly busy that night, so I understand that you're going to have to wait a bit. Someone else apparently did not understand this and all I saw down the bar to my left was a glass flying into the bar taps I think. She told him (them?) to get the fuck out, and if you don't like waiting, then leave. So sorry. I'm glad she stood up for herself and essentially told them to fuck off and go home.

Not sure if and when I will be back, but it's so close to The Regency Ballroom that it's really really convenient before a show, particularly if you don't want to walk up from the Polk street bars in the rain, you know, if you're afraid of water.
author: Ken L.

description:
I know I drank more than 101 beers and cheers! The Spanish fly and I haven't been there for years and years... I think when I did go back again  for the first time since I left SF they just remodeled. So, yeah it's been a longtime...............

The bartender was this hot little Irish girl with black hair... Great girl!!!!!!!!!!!! Good times...... Nice service.. Yep, It's empty at times..... But that was one of my best times there... Started the bar up when it opened and played pool. Then two Swedish bikini girls come in to drink as well. We played pool and boozed!!!!!  Beer commercial with no show to interupt us! What A night! Thanks! Route 101!!!!!!!! That's just one day. Played darts with the owner. Great close games. Nice people...... Thanks Justin. miss ya.
author: Shawn S.

description:
I have been wanting to check this place out for quite some time so when I was invited to meet some people there I jumped at the chance.

Route 101 is not what I expected it to be. For one thing it is not a dive bar; it's a sports bar, it's a neighborhood hang out, and they have a couple of serious pool tables in back. It's a decent place but there's nothing divey about it. From the outside it looks like it's going to be small but it goes way back.

The beer is $4.50 which is a little too much for this kind of place and the whiskey neat I ordered seemed a little skimpy; maybe I've been spoiled by heavy handed dive bar bartenders. The staff is friendly but the regulars seem a little douchey.

The honest truth is that while it's pretty good bar there are so many bars I like better within a short walk that I probably won't be back often.
author: Manny F.

description: The snotty bartender accused my ID of being fake. Awkward when you turn away a legal patron. Save your money (and possibly a likelihood of getting Hep A judging by the place), and walk down the street to any other of the bars. There will be a bartender willing to serve a legal adult.
author: Gina G.

description:
Do you like to play pool? If yes, then go to this bar. They have two pool tables in the back, and the people playing are always willing to compete (and they're good).

I have to knock off one star, however, because there's no smoking room and the bartender got an attitude with my girlfriend for having a Hawaii ID with a San Francisco address on it (she's 24!). That's where she's from, duhhhhhhhhhhh. I was with a group of people, all 25 or older, and the girl still questioned whether the ID was real or not. What a goober.

What I do like about this place (other than dual pool tables) is the fact that I've never seen it extremely crowded. I live only a few blocks away, and even on a Friday night it's got a medium-sized crowd. I don't like big crowds at bars because I can't hear myself talk. Isn't drinking supposed to be social?
author: Eliot R.

description:
Here's what I remember:

A few friends/relatives were in town visiting. You know, yelp would be alot cooler if we could include pictographs in our reviews.

For example, I was sitting at counter (a) on bar stool (b) explaning the joy of sailing to fellow bar guest (c) while my cousin (d) stared on in near drunken oblivion. As I (a) leaned back on my stool (b) to demonstrate the joys of leaning backwards on a hobie cat to take in the water, and rush of wind, I fell ass over tea kettle (b - a) and ended up on the carpeted floor. After the ensuing gaffaws and wtfs (d mostly, although with an outstretched hand), I (a) hauled myself up and into the ladies' where I notice a bit of a scrape on my forehead. 

The rest of the night was spent playing arcade golf, with random strangers. Not the most fun night, because there weren't many people there to schmooze. Correction, there weren't many schmoozies in their 20s - the handful of folks were all 40+. I was trying to get a live night on the town going with friends, not terribly successful . 

The bartender is a chatty cathy, and pretty cool.

Cut to the next very hungover morning. I walk into the bathroom and scream at the horror that is my face. I have a bloated, white, oozing open sore on my forehead the size of a silver dollar. Que HORROR! Yep, it was a rugburn.

So kudos to the fellow patrons, for  still talking to me, and thanks to the bartender for still serving me. I think. 

Two weeks later I returned after a p-funk concert with a bandaged head. 

Okay space. And they don't kick you out if you're fugly.
author: Em L.

description: Ahhhhh..... Route. It is what it is folks...a solid, good old-fashioned dive bar. The BEST dive bar at that. The ladies that tend bar Alli (sp), Nicole and Natalie have got this place under mother effin control. Courteous, quick and,  when necessary, super cautious to a randy weirdo who might stumble in. This no frills joint clearly has a huge base of loyal patrons who look out for the overall wellbeing of everyone there, and that is very cool. Cheap pool, fun jukebox and prompt service, what more could you ask for??? Love.
author: El M.

description: I like a good dive bar and this place fits in well. The only thing missing are some pickled eggs!
author: Leanne S.

description: My friend was appalled, and she's not even as big a feminist as I am. The sexist "video games" at this bar are unacceptable.
author: Bronwyn G.

description:
If you want to be guaranteed a pool table then this is the spot. They have two pool tables and even around midnight on a Saturday night it wasn't that crowded. This is definitely a dive bar, but a great one! The jukebox was consistently playing awesome music, and not just when I was picking the songs. The drinks were cheap. There were three couches forming a U if you want to chill, a decent size bar, a big screen tv and a few other tvs playing sports and just a super laid-back vibe. 

This isn't the type of place I would come to hit on guys but I will definitely be back with friends.
author: Jackie G.

description:
I'm bumping this place up a star!

Why?!?!

They have Magners Irish Cider!!!

....and the bartender asks you if you want it on ice!  Boo-yeah!
author: Jenn A.

description:
One would expect that a bar taking on the name Route 101 would honor the tradition of this fantastic historic stretch of West Coast road (registered in the 20s, if I recall correctly) that takes you through so many interesting places. One would think they would have some memorabilia or photos or sense of history waiting for you when you walk in.

Sadly no. 

This place would be better named "VH1 - I love the 80s" since it more closely memorializes mullets, couches upholstered in rec room brown patterns, kegs of beer that taste like they are relics stocked up on in that decade and Spuds McKenzie. 

The place is large and in addition to the couches I would highly recommend not sitting on (they look like they have been collecting spilled drinks and bodily fluid since the 80s) they have a few TVs, a few pool tables and a whole lot of people hanging out talking about the latest tragedy in their lives and how great a year 1988 was for fashion. 

Oh, and, so I have been told, it is pretty easy to have sex in the restrooms here so I would refrain from sitting on the toilet seats as well....they also look like they haven't been cleaned since 1982.
author: Drue C.

description:
Pirate Pub Crawl bar #5

This bar is more hoppin' on a weekend night, especially if you bring 15-20 pirates (and a few wannabe's) with you.  The bartender eyed us with a slight bit of disdain, but kept the drinks a-flowin'.  In my book, that'll do.
author: Andi T.

description: You get good cheap alcohol and a pool table.  What do you expect?
author: Byron L.

description:
I generally go to bars with two missions in mind: socialize and drink.

The socialization agenda met with great fanfare.  I caught up with some good friends while I was there.  I met some new people who regaled me with great tales of fetching their own personal blender so that Bill Cosby could have his fruit smoothies.

The drinks... well... the drinks were just bad.  Everything tasted dirtier than normal for a dive bar.  I started with a Gin and Tonic.  Not very good.  So I switch to beer.  Two different beers from the taps tasted stale.  PBR in a can?  Just right.

Stick to things in bottles or cans at this place.

Oh yeah, they did play "Hot For Teacher" on their big screen TV.  Bonus.  This video is clearly superior to A-Ha's "Take On Me".
author: Christopher K.

description:
If you like dive bars, this is a good one.  They serve hot dogs straight from their microwave (which is exactly how dive bar hot dogs should be prepared).  Hot dogs help when you've had too much to drink by either helping your stomach stay down or come back up.

Good drunk pool in the back.  But watch out for my pool sharkin' brother because he's not as drunk as he pretends to be.

You see the caption says Pacific Heights?  Since when did Pacific Heights have dive bars and weekly hotels?  It's not Pac Heights, it's the 'Loin.
author: Ann W.

description:
The Route is my local dive bar.  Its a cool place to go if you don't want to wait in line for a drink and you can always find a place to sit down and relax.  The bartenders are friendly and they have a great jukebox.  

The people in this place are usually pretty random.  An example:  Have you ever been on the 38 Geary bus?  I was on one time around 5:30 after work on a week day.  And this INSANE drunk wreck of a woman was stumbling around in the front talking mad sh*t to anyone and everyone coming on and off the bus.  Slurring her words and spinning around every which way.  "Yo b*tch what the f*** mothaf***er".  Anyways I saw her at the Route one night calmly sucking down a drink at the bar a couple of seats away from me.  I really got a kick out of that.

The only down side is the bathrooms but what do you expect from a dive bar?
author: Tom K.

description:
Walking into this bar is like walking into Tree's Lounge. I half expected Steve Buschemi to sit down in the stool next to me.

While not quite as gritty as the bars Bukowski frequented, this bar bounces between being truly divey and a little lounge-esque. There is a nice array of couches, and some good pool tables, but place itself, well... maintence isn't really a priority, but I like it that way.

And I still don't understand my friends'  growing interest in having sex in the bathrooms of dive bars we frequent. Maybe I'm just a little more dsicriminate with where I'll have sex in public because the tiny, grungy bathrooms here certainly did not seem arousing to me.

Then again I probably shouldn't talk. The girl I ended bringing to the bar was married and had her husband meet with us all. At least I didn't catalyze a divorce this time.
author: Keith M.

description:
You know that video game machine that sits on the bar, that has a whole bunch of games including the one where you find five little differences between the almost identical photos of naked ladies? We know it simply as "the game."

Well, I went into the Route the other day, and learned the hard way that they have taken "the game" away. The machine is still there, but has been stripped of erotic options.

I'm done with this place.
author: Jason R.

description:
I recommend this bar if your looking for a mellow place to just hang out and chat with some friends or a date. It's just simply a bar. It has a couple of pool tables but I have never played while there. The bartenders remember my drink every time I walk back in. They remember my name and has a Cheers feel (with a SF vibe).

Often this is where I go after work and hang with a date or friends and sit on the couch, watch the game and enjoy some drinks.

The only negative part is the music at times can be somewhat loud. You could ask them to turn it down or up if it's a particularly cool song.
author: Kevin L.

description:
Love this damn bar. Love it for the simple fact that it's a dive bar, it has pool tables, serves Stella, and the music selection on the juke box is good stuff.

It's a dive, but it's a fun and friendly dive.
author: Nikki M.

description:
CJ picked me up at my Mardi Gras party at R Bar and we carried on back to my house, stopping along the way at Route 101. A dive bar, that has always looked so divey I have been rather scared to go there thinking it was a rough looking place where probably local men who have been going for years went to.

We just stayed for one beer, but the bartender was able to take what I said I was drinking earlier and help me along with my drink decision (which to be honest, sometimes takes awhile.)

We played pool - wait did we bet twenty dollars on a shot???? Did I end up winning? Anyway, I had a great time. I love playing pool and it was really a fun night. No free pool however, so I am not sure if that makes it as divey. The most fun part of the night, which makes me smile at the memory was me chasing around the pool table. I couldn't catch him, are we surprised!

The night didn't end hhere... because we left, and of course needed a night cap.....
author: Danielle V.

description: Sort of depressing as not much of a crowd comes by this area is search of a bar, but they have two nice pool tables and some old couches and TVs.  Pretty clean.  Great Dirty Harry pinball machine.  Serviceable spot for drinking if in the area or you live nearby, but not a spot worth going out of the way to visit.
author: Marc S.

description: Not looking to compete with the rowdiness of other bars on Polk, we stumbled upon this place for a late Christmas night cap.  The bartender was dressed festively and was very friendly, and the place was spacious but not empty.  Any place where people can have a few drinks without shouting to maintain a decent conversation is okay by me.
author: Jenn C.

description:
I went to an Atmosphere show  at the Grand earlier this year.. and actually used the ATM in this bar but didn't grab a drink.  (The Grand is right across the street!  So if you go to a show there you should hit up this bar!)
One of my best friends moved up to the city..  right off of Van Ness.  We went to Route 101 last night.. trying to find something close to his place.  The bartender was super sweet and she even "created" drinks for us; and the price wasn't bad at all!  

This place has two pool tables and a couple couches.  Nice little dive bar.. we will definitely go again :)
author: Regina B.

description:
2 pool tables.  Friendly folks that leave ya alone if you want, or will chat with ya.  they sell pitchers of beer too!

This is a friendly not quite as dark as many of the other bars I frequent sort of place with beer and mixed drinks.  I'm not completely impressed with the beer selection, but I've been turning into a beer snob and getting excited about fancy pants brands on tap these days, so I am admittedly getting hard to please.  The other day I was there, and the bass tap line was not very clean, but the bartender was more than happy to comp me a drink, and said that I should always let him know if it wasn't up to par.  John's the bartender that I almost always see there, in the after work sort of time line, and he's always been friendly and not snotty.

This is also a friendly place a gal can play a really poor game of pool and not have a bunch of dorky guys try to tell me how to do it.  (yeah, that's right, I just need to play more, and then I'll get better....meanwhile, you running your mouth means that you're simply distracting me and making it take even longer!)
author: Rebecca R.

description:
4 stars for being true to the genre. Isn't Van Ness technically part of Hwy 101? Hence the name? I agree with everyone below, I would only add that it gets an extra star because they serve hot dogs, pretty much on demand. They used to be $1.00 but now they've gone up to $2.50 but the bartender correctly points out that they are bigger than they used to be. 

I like to go to the gym, work out hard and come here for a beer and dog, figuring I'm breaking even for the day.
author: jim b.

description:
Went on a Thurs to pick up a friend.  I didn't have any drinks so I can't comment on them.  I was only there for about 5 mins.  The place seemed pretty big although it was empty except for a few folks at the bar.  They have a jukebox and at least one pool table.  

The crowd seemed like a bunch of older locals.  Definitely not a mingling spot (at least not at 1am on a Thurs).  My friend commented, "Isn't that the oldest bartender you've ever seen?"   I thought that was cold...but I couldn't disagree...she was friendly though.

I'm don't frequent dive bars, so I'm no expert, but if this ain't a dive bar, then I don't know what is.
author: One Black Mans POV.. ..

description: This bar is everything a bar should be.  Lots of room for the two pool tables in the back, a projection screen for sports, cheap drinks and lots of space.  Plus it's right between me best mate's place and my house.
author: Corey V.

description: Dangerously close to the Regency for a pre/post show beverage. Sadly, the taps lack Anchor or Speakeasy. Shame.
author: Maximillian M.

description:
Smallest restroom award. Fairly large place with pool tables in the back.
The jukebox is good, and entertaining. There are people in bands that work here as tenders and apparently hipped up the box. Bartenders are cool , especially  the Irish woman. Plenty of Tv's to watch sports, including big screens. Some locals hang here as well as tourists and commuters-a good mix.
This is a great location for a bar-right on a main path of the city.
Recommended.
author: Mag N.

description: I have been coming to this bar for quite sometime now since I live right down the street and I always have a great time! But they just got a new bartender Nicole and she seems to make the place even better than before. Congrats to whomever hired her!! Great girl!
author: lisa v.

description: Came here last night for the first time after noticing the place for 3 years and wondering about it.  I have to say it wasn't really what I expected.  For some reason I thought this place was a major dive, but it turns out it's a pretty decent "normal" bar.  The place had just enough people in it to feel lively on a Friday night while still remaining pretty chill.  It was easy to get a pool table, and there was no "scene" to put up with.  Hung out, had a few beers with friends, played some pool, all in all not a bad place to stop by on Friday night.
author: Joshua W.

description:
This could be thee best jukebox in SF!  Check it out.

PBR (sorry, soft spot for hillbilly beer), plenty of great booze to choose from for shots, and Hobie is king.  The most down to earth baretnder, certainly in this neck of the woods.

always good for people watching too, you will get some local elements.  Nice!
author: david s.

description:
This is a perfect spot to start the night, or chill out when you don't want to stay out too late. I say so because I've noticed it gets very packed late at night. Probably not every night, but I've walked by when the crowd was pouring out the door.

There are a few major feathers in this place's so-called cap. First, it has two pool tables, and both of them have enough room around them to be accessible. Secondly, it has a "Golden Tee" arcade game. I'm a sucker for arcade golf games with the roller ball. It really puts you in the game! Finally, there's a really cool little lounge area in the back by the pool tables. There's a few couches, some big chairs, and some coffee tables. It's cool to be able to take a business associate, or a cheap hooker, into the back to sit comfortably and enjoy a Guinness.

This place is slightly more expensive than places I usually go, but it's also nowhere near as expensive as the places I tend to avoid. I would recommend this place to a friend for sure.
author: Adam R.

description:
I'm just gonna go ahead and say that this is one of the weirdest bars I have ever been to.  It is like community center meets midwestern dive.  

Pluses - really comfortable couches, super nice bartender lady, 1.50 PBR, rad juke box, two pool tables, NEVER crowded.

Minuses - its just f*)(^*)* weird. Go there to see for yourself.  There are dudes in there seriously sporting handlebars and mullets...'nuff said.
author: Jennifer C.

description:
Update 6/19:  I am told that it's not as divey as it used to be and that the wagon wheel tables are no longer there.  I have not been there in quite a long time.  

It's a dive for sure.  Not a bad place to kill time before a movie at one of the nearby theatres.  Wagon wheel tables and a jukebox that I don't really remember as being extra good or extra bad.
author: T-Bone L.

description: We like to check out dive bars & old man bars.  Route 101 seemed to fit the bill but unfortunately one person at the bar was too smashed and seemed like he could get a bit out of control so we had one and left.  The bar tender should have kicked him out or cut him off before we got there especially since the next bartender was a girl.
author: Dianne M.

description: This place was empty when we came! It's a pretty small place, the bathroom's a bit janky, and there are only 2 pool tables in the back. Not exactly the best place to go shoot pool, but it's super cheap. $1 in coins per game, and the bartender can break your dollar bills for coins.
author: Lily C.

description:
This is a dive bar.  2 pool tables, a few sketchy couches, a juke box, TVs, and some great bartenders.  What more can you ask for?  Always good times to be had at the Route.

One more thing - best Bloody Marys in the city.  Yes this sounds strange but it's true.  They make 'em from scratch with like 12 different ingrediments.
author: Ben K.

description: Good luck finding this place on your GPS, haha. A very clean dive bar. Good service from behind the bar, and good nut selection (not talking about the clientele), and the drinks are cheap, well, at happy hour. Why the $3.25 price for a PBR though? I plan on returning for their aforementioned bloody mary.
author: wayne s.

description: This is just a good dive to get a drink with a friend when you feel like getting drunk in a place where you can have a conversation and not worry about interacting with anyone.  I have never seen the bar crowded but the drinks are cheap and the last time I was there the beefy bartender was wearing a leather vest with a cowboy hat and watching Oprah on the big screen.  I'm a fan of randomness so 3.5 stars for that.
author: Jessica H.

description: Something tells me if you picked someone up here you could describe them in the same way you'd describe the bar-a little rough around the edges, dark and brooding inside but more or less friendly. The two words dive bar are definatly a good catagorization of this place. Has all the fixins to make up a dive bar from the cheap drinks, nuked hot dogs, pool tables, patrons talking to the bartenders or staring in their drinks. It's close enough to get bombed here before or after a movie at the AMC. What oh what will the local patrons do when/ if the "ironic hipsters" of Polk take over? Watch out!
author: Veronica G.

description: I like this place for it's consistency.  It has, for the most part, remained the same for a long, long time.  I'm always comfortable sitting on my stool near the door drinking, people watching and enjoying a conversation or two with the talkative types who might wander in.
author: Janet W.

description: If you're looking for a no-frills place to hang out with friends, relax, play pool, pinball, watch TV, or play some great jukebox music without pretension, then this is your place.  This a "family owned" business and you feel just like part of the family being there.
author: Karen R.

description: Everything that everyone else wrote is true.  Seen it with my own eyes, yep.  A dive, couches, vidjya games, pool, cheap drinks, TVs.  I am hanging my head while admitting that my friends and I closed this place down wearing formal night attire, post holiday party last night.  We were sore thumbs, but we also accounted for half the people in the bar.  It woulda been a good fight, yep.  Nothing really sticks out about this place... except maybe my friends and me.
author: Jessica M.

description: Have recently stumbled upon this dive in my hood, and I have to say- it ain't bad. Decently strong drinks, a whole truckload of space in the back where you can play some pool without having to listen to some marina trash talk on their phones, have some asshole eyeing your tits, or basically deal with the rest of the daily bullshit in this city :) It's chill and unpretentious. And the owners seem cool to boot.
author: Libby T.

description: This place stares at me from across the road as I slog away on the stairmaster machine, and sometimes the tempation of an after-workout beer proves too much. It's a somewhat nondescript place, too big to be cosy and lacking a certain character. It's not ultra-divey, but very unpretentious and the clientele is authentic. Can occasionally get invaded by groups of students on a pub crawl. The pool tables have seen better days, but if you are in the neighbourhood and need a beer and a quick frame then you could do worse.
author: Stuart J.

description: We went in here last night craving a really divey dive. It really wasn't that divey. But the bartender was super sweet. And we liked it enough. To keep on drinking anyway.
author: Sarah R.

description: I used to live a few blocks from this dump, and as a result I ended up drinking here more times than I'd like to admit.... but to be honest, it's a pretty decent dive bar.  It's never crowded, there's a few pool tables, and a few couches to sit on.  I almost forgot -- the jukebox kicks ass.
author: Andrew E.

description: This used to be the best bar in the loin, until they opened the place off the alley named after a poisonous potable. I still really like the 101, the owners are chatty & friendly, but not in that annoying way. I used to work with a girl who shagged one of the bartenders on a couch, so I don't like to sit on those when I go. He's a cutie, but she's a skank.
author: Colleen B.

description: Great neighborhood bar on Van Ness Avenue. Unpretentious, friendly crowd with two pool tables, good couches, and an outstanding jukebox (Supersuckers, Social D, etc...). Great bartenders, stiff drinks, good prices.  Convenient place to meet up before or after a movie at the AMC 1000.
author: Dan L.

description: This is an after-work mecca for my coworkers. I only go in there on Fridays when the greatest, hardest working, take-no-shit, hot as hell bartender Natalie is working. The jukebox has some country hits available, which is another upside. The crowd is generally laid back and it's the kind of place you can go to alone and read a book or talk to your creepy overly-friendly neighbor. Or you can go with friends and take over the couches. Either way, it's not the best bar in the city, but it's comfy and often entertaining- especially when the douchebags stumble over from the Regency and are ripe for the mocking.
author: Sara M.

description:
I've been kicked out of like a half dozen bars in town....Like on the for reals psuedo outlaw badass bars...Fucking punk bitches....But this is one I have yet to fuck off...Only because Hobie, Mac Trey and the wonderfull Scotttish? Brittish? proprietress make me feel like family or atleast welcomed....These are straight out my kinda people....BTW to the reviewer behind me Mr.Drue C....We don't need no stinking placards, memorabilia or otherwise bullshit....Peak on gay places along the 101 in Marin or Ventura for that lameness- Fucking 
Chump!
author: Michael V.

description: I always find a place to park. It has great bartenders...can't believe how cheap the drinks are and they aren't watered down. It has two pool tables in the back and enough room for parties of 25 to 30 to have a party. There is a sofa sitting area in the middle and the bathrooms are clean. Juke box for music. Friendly local crowd.
author: Monica L.

description: Very divey and a mellow spot. Some of my buddies don't like it because there's only been one time more than 20 people were in here, and the bar emptied out after an hour or so. I like it specifically because of this and the drinks are cheap. Beers are in the $3 range. There are some pool tables in the back and comfy couches. The bathroom is pretty sketchy, but what dive bar has a really clean one???
author: The Sock S.

description:
so i go here a lot because it's like 2 blocks from where i work, but the one shitty thing about this place is that their draft beer usually taste like shit due to the fact that they don't clean their lines!  rule number one in my book, never ever ever compromise the integrity of beer!!!!  i hate to sound like a beer snob, and i know  i kinda' am one, but really... who wants to drink shitty tasting beer... i rest my case!


on the plus side though, i get off of work and usually head straight there on tuesdays with some friends from work and get my buzz on immediately!  another great thing about this joint is that they show every single mlb game that is on that day!  i am a ny mets fan and during the season i can watch my boys do their thing and talk mad shit about giants fans while they all drink their sorrows away!  i don't really care about the pool table in the back, but if you feel inclined to get a game going on to show what you're made of, then thats fine by me... more elbow room @ the bar for me!!!!

3 out of 5 stars ain't that bad, but once again the only reason for this rating is because of the dirty ass sock tasting lines...

c'mon guys, clean the fuckin' lines already!!!!

see ya' there on tuesday y'all!!!!




***ursa major***
author: Michael M.

description: Super divey! This bar is incredibly HUGE! I had no idea. They have pool in the back, a big screen and comfy couches. We had the dog parade in tow so it was great that they were dog friendly too.
author: Douggers M.

description: When the Van Ness rennaisance (never) happens, this place is gonna be the shit.
author: Nick P.

description: I'd go back again. The patrons and the barkeep were friendly as hell. Plus they have a couple pool tables and a decent juke.
author: Ryan R.

description: Yup - I'd say that this place falls under the 'dive' category... in a good way, of course. Pool tables and an adequate juke box. I got the feeling that we were the non-regulars at the bar, and that we were outnumbered as such. I assume that the pool tables are probably the primary draw at this place.
author: Tre S.

description: straight up dive bar but clean and friendly with lots of room.  good place to play pool or chill and watch sports if you are not looking to run into anybody.
author: Jonas C.

description: Quietish even on the weekends.  A good alternative to the other bars in the area.  Staff is very friendly and helpful.  Local 'home' bar feel.  They have a good selection of beer.
author: Jon R.

description: This place is a great spot to stop and grab a drink...although I've yet to go there at night...it seems like a more of a Sunday afternoon poolspot for cheap drinks and a low-key vibe before a movie...bartenders are friendly, prices are reasonable, and hey---they don't forget a face.  They enjoy repeat business, customer service, all of the things that I was complaining about below...
author: Laura Noël S.

description: I tend to look for a few key things when choosing a bar - nice people, pool tables, and dog tolerance.  As the 101 has all three, I like that place! My dog acts like she runs that bar, and nobody tells her otherwise.  Friendly people work there.  I always go there on Halloween, for some reason.
author: Chuck B.

description: Alli is always friendly and loving, always remembers faces and is quick on the refills, LOVE that girl!! Anyone who says other wise should get to know her better, thats all.
author: Quinn S.

description:
lets start with the cowbot hat... 
makers neat and a corona
i dont care if they "pair" well together he always serves it with a smile
two pool tables
I'll rack you break

i love this bar
whats the plural of y'all?

all y"all!!
word
author: Nick W.

description: I love this bar. Drinks are kinda pricey. I.  Plus the staff is always friendly and they just put a new jukebox in.
author: Krissy P.

description: prototypical dive bar.  kinda grimey, beat up couches, couple busted pool tables, and an old jukebox.  but as a dive, it's great.  drinks are CHEAP.  like $3.50 for a gin and tonic, and the pool is cheap too...
author: Terence M.

description: This place has a charm that just doesn't get old. I've been here many times. Some of these times, I'm the only one there, but many times there are transient folks, all walks of life, from just about anywhere mixed in with regulars and overflow from the nightclub/party venue next door that makes for a interesting mix of people which I enjoy. You can come here by yourself and have a few beers and watch TV without feeling uncomfortable. The bartenders are really great friendly people, and the owners are the same. I'd like to see the plumbing fixed, and the couch/carpet cleaned as others have mentioned. There are a few regulars that I  tend to avoid, but some of them are great folks. I would say that this bar can get edgy more than you might expect so you have to pay attention to who you talk to sometimes, but overall I think it is a great place to grab a drink and shoot pool. Sometimes randomly you will see a rocker like Lemmy from Motorhead here.
author: Andrew Z.
